result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michelle A Peterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michelle A Peterson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michelle A Peterson in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed outright. 

The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent including parenting classes.
*No violent contact with any family member
*60 days of Day Report Center.

FINE:  $505 (apply bail).

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200 (apply bail).
